III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
The Foster Care Worker communicates disrespectfully with the birth
parents, using derogatory language.
Allegation 2:
The foster worker is writing documents which are not on agency
letterhead or are not official and having the birth parent to signs the
document(s).
Investigation I had email contact with the Chief Administrator (CA) on
5/30/2024. I spoke with her directly about the complaint allegations
on 6/4/2024. CA did not have direct information about the
allegations. She reported being aware that the birth parents are
ones who always seem to have concerns, and who have tried to
record staff’s phone conversation with them or to document things
in an attempt to show a concern. She reported neither birth parent
has contacted her about these concerns, but the agency’s
Administrative Director had contact with the parents on 6/2/2024.
She reported the agency’s team members are communicating daily
to create a plan on how to move forward collaboratively with
addressing each concern from the birth parents. The staff on the
case would be better able to address each allegation.
Interviews:
Allegation 1:
I interviewed Birth Parent 1 by telephone on 5/29/2024 and Birth
Parent 2 by telephone on 6/6/2024.
Birth Parent 1 reported usually at every visit Foster Care Worker
2

(FCW) makes to their home, FCW is disrespectful to them and
curses them. Birth Parent 1 reported FCW tells them to shut up and
has made smart or inappropriate comments to them. Such as when
Birth Parent 2 asked FCW about receipt of their drug screens, FCW
responded “how do you know we don’t have it and we are just not
telling you we have received it.” Birth Parent 1 did not clarify what
that meant or how that statement was disrespectful.
Birth Parent 1 reported informing Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)
about their concerns with FCW via text on or about 5/22/2024. He
told Foster Care Supervisor he and Birth Parent 2 no longer wanted
FCW in their home because today was not the day for FCW to be
disrespectful, that they were tired of it, and were filing a complaint.
He also told FCS this concern by telephone two weeks ago. He
reported telling the agency’s Program Manager about the concern
as well. He said the Program Manager was at their home visit on
5/28/2024 and did not address the matter. Birth Parent 1 admitted
that a Zoom meeting was scheduled for them today with Program
Manager, Foster Care Supervisor and FCW to discuss his and Birth
Parent 2’s concerns.
Birth Parent 2 neither reported, nor confirmed the allegation that
FCW cursed her and Birth Parent 1. She confirmed Birth Parent 1’s
reporting about FCW’s rudeness/statement to her when she asked
him about one of her drug screen results. She reported FCW told
her he was not giving them the information.
Birth Parent 2 reported the agency and FCW has no regard for them
and continues to inflict harm on her and her family by their actions.
Birth Parent 2 made that statement after referencing a number of
things she stated had taken place on the case that did not relate to
this specific allegation. Such as why/how the children came into
care, the agency changing their parenting time visitation from
unsupervised visits to supervised, and the worker reporting a
concern with her housing/lease.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) about this allegation
by telephone on 5/31/2024. He reported prior to 5/24/2024 he had
never heard the birth parents report that FCW was disrespectful or
that he cursed them. He stated the birth parents sent him a text
message on 5/24/2024 saying they were tired of the disrespect and
that FCW is no longer welcome in their home. At that time, the birth
parent did not elaborate on how FCW was disrespectful, or what
FCW had done or said. FCS reported, during a telephone call with
the birth parents by the agency’s Program Manager on 5/29/2024,
the birth parents mentioned something about FCW disrespecting
3

them. They indicated FCW told them to “shut your mouths and
listen to me”.
FCS reported he spoke with FCW about the allegations indicated by
the birth parents. FCW denied them. FCW reported the birth parents
were unhappy with him following a home visit on 5/22/2024
whereby he had to let the birth parents know that due to a DHHS
complaint alleging Birth Parent 1 left one of children in a car
unattended, the agency had to initiate a safety plan with them and
that their unsupervised visits were reversed to supervised visits.
FCS reported regarding drug screens, the agency generally sends
this information to court with the court report. The workers check
the birth parents drug tests weekly to discern for any positive drug
screens. Thereon, the worker lets the birth parent know as soon as
possible about those results. He reported that would have been the
same case scenario with Birth Parent 1 and Birth Parent 2’s results
unless they were not received timely. He reported the birth parents
may be upset about those results. He reported the birth parents
alleged Birth Parent 2’s positive drug screen result for
methamphetamine was false. He reported the birth parent was
upset, insisted the test result was some type of false positive but
Fluorine Fluids reported the drug screen results as accurate. He
reported a social work contact on or about 4/19/2024 would indicate
information about that.
Additionally, FCS reported being unable to visualize FCW saying to
a client what is alleged related to this complaint. He reported FCW
has not had disciplinary actions, and no concerns have been
reported about his interaction/engagement with others.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. He reported being the case manager on the
case for Child A, Child B and Child C since April 2024. He admitted
he may have used a curse word indirectly when speaking with the
birth parents, like this “shit is crazy, but he denied ever cursing them
or telling them to shut up. Nor did he tell them anything like “how do
you know I don’t have it and I’m just not giving it to you”, in
reference to drug screen results. He reported the birth parents may
be upset with him over the fact that he has been the bearer of bad
news. Such as, he had to tell them the agency had to end their
unsupervised parenting time and the birth parents did not like that.
He denied that he has been disrespectful to them. He reported he
has told them he knows some things, but not all things. He has told
them he will have to get back to them to provide the information
they requested because he may not have it or did not know it at the
4

time. He reported giving them drug screen results that he has
access to. He reported many times Birth Parent 2 talks really fast,
ask for one thing, then when FCW provides the information, she
reports she/they asked for something else. He said he tries to write
the things down that he may need to follow up on. He said, Birth
Parent 2 records conversations she has with him and others and
has reported she does that so she can remember what she said. He
reported that in that same regards he shared with Birth Parent 2 if
she can’t remember what she said, then why would she expect he
would, unless he wrote it down.
I interviewed Program Manager (PM) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. PM reported she has no reason to believe
this allegation. She reported FCS addressed the allegation with
FCW. FCW denied the allegation. PM reported Birth Parent 1 and
Birth Parent 2 have presented as very difficult to communicate with,
especially Birth Parent 2. PM said the agency is working on how to
better address and respond to the birth parents, especially Birth
Parent 2, given Birth Parent 2’s tendency to interrupt and cut the
staff persons off in conversations. She confirmed CA’s reporting
related to the agency’s continued plan to work with the birth parents
related to concerns the birth parents may bring forth.
Allegation 2:
I interviewed Birth Parent 1 by telephone on 5/29/2024 and Birth
Parent 2 by telephone on 6/6/2024.
Birth Parent 1 reported following a complaint lodged against him
and Birth Parent 2, the FCW wrote out a safety plan on paper right
in front of him and had him to sign it. He said the document was not
on letterhead. He questioned that document being real or
professional. Two weeks ago, he asked where the real safety plan
was and learned that was it. He reported that he did not get a copy
of the safety plan and believes it was something done just to save
the agency’s “butt.” He did not explain the meaning of that or how
the safety plan would have saved the agency. He denied there
being another document that was unofficial or written up by FCW
that was of concern.
Birth Parent 2 reported lots of information about her case which did
not relate to this allegation. She did not disclose information about
this allegation or her signature on the document Birth Parent 1
reported on. The only document she referenced signing or
reportedly being forced to sign was one related to placement of her
children with her father that did not relate to this agency.
5

I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) about this allegation
by telephone on 5/31/2024. He reported the only document FCW
had the birth parent(s) sign was a safety plan. He reported that
safety plan was handwritten and hand written safety plans are
allowed by the agency.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. He reported after he was notified of a DHHS
allegation against the birth parents related to one of the children
being left unattended for a time in the birth parents’ car, he had to
make a home visit with the birth parents within 24-hours. He took
paper with him and wrote up a safety plan. He denied being told or
advised a safety plan must be typed or be on agency letterhead. He
was told the document can just be scanned and upload into
MISACWIS.
He reported during the home visit with the birth parents he
discussed the complaint allegations, attempted to safety plan with
the birth parents around not leaving the children unattended, and to
conducted drug testing on them. He reported the bulk of the
discussion was with Birth Parent 1. Birth Parent 2 stayed in her
room and refused to come out or to come sign the document. Birth
Parent 1 signed the document and FCW asked him if Birth Parent 2
would sign it the next day. The next day Birth Parent 2 texted FCW
and asked him why she would “sign something under duress”.
FCW reported not knowing what Birth Parent 2 was referencing with
her duress statement. He said he turned the safety plan over to his
supervisor for her to try to get Birth Parent 2’s signature. He said,
as recent as 5/28/2024 FCS attempted to get Birth Parent 2’s
signature and Birth Parent 2 refused to sign the document.
I interviewed Program Manager (PM) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. PM reported information similarly to FCS
related to a safety plan being attempted with the birth parents. She
confirmed FCW’s reporting that the handwritten safety plan was
around supervision of the children following a DHHS complaint
related to the birth parents. She further confirmed FCS’s and FCW’s
indications that the agency does not always type up these
documents or have a requirement that they be typed. She advised
the agency can do a better job with the content on the plans and
labeling them. She said another document was typed up for this
plan and both birth parents refused to sign it.
Document Review
A handwritten safety plan received from FCS that indicated:
• Don’t leave the car with children inside. Don’t leave children
6

unattended. If you have to run an errand have another
approved adult supervise the children. Children may only be
supervised by an approved adult.
• This document was signed by FCW and Birth Parent 1 on
5/22/2024.
• A written notation dated 5/22/2024 stated Birth Parent 2
refused to sign.
Child A’s, Child B’s, and Child C’s MISACWIS case record showed:
• A 5/22/2024 social work case narrative showing FCW’s home
visits with Birth Parent 1 and Birth Parent 2, and FCW’s
attempt to go over the safety plan with both parents. The
narrative also showed information as described by FCW
related to Birth Parent 2 refusing to leave her room, talk, or
engage with him and refusing to sign the safety plan.
• Another handwritten safety plan with information similar to
the one listed above showed FCW and another person
signed it on 5/22/2024. The plan had a handwritten notation
on it stating that another person (no name) gave verbal
approval on 5/23/2024. A 5/22/2024 social work narrative
showed an exchange with the Caregiver Spouse in person,
and the Caregiver by telephone at that time about this safety
plan.
• Another safety plan typed on agency letterhead which had
handwritten corrections, and indicated the information
reported in the first safety plan for Birth Parent 1 and Birth
Parent 2 around not leaving their minor children in a car
unattended. This safety plan was signed by both Birth
Parent 1, Birth Parent 2 and FCW on 6/6/6024.
• A 4/19/2024 social work contact as referenced by FCS which
showed what FCS indicated when he was interviewed.
Analysis Based on information from interviews and documentation reviewed,
the evidence does not substantiate the allegations or a lack of
worker character or suitability to meet the needs of children and
families served by the agency.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABILISHED.
Rule Code Staff responsibilities.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be directly
Description responsible for all the following activities:
(a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-home care. Social
service workers shall work directly with the children, their families,
and other relevant individuals and be primarily responsible for the
7

development, implementation, and review of service plans for the
children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation Allegation 1
The agency is allowing the Caregiver’s spouse to smoke drugs in
front of the children.
Allegation 2
The agency is not keeping the birth parents aware of their children’s
medical, dental and educational events. Nor is the agency doing
what is required to aid the birth parents in the children’s return
home.
Investigation Interviews:
Allegation 1:
I interviewed Birth Parent 1 by telephone on 5/29/2024 and Birth
Parent 2 by telephone on 6/6/2024:
Birth Parent 1 and Birth Parent 2 both reported Caregiver’s
Spouse smoked in front of the children. Birth Parent 1 reported
Caregiver allows Caregiver’s Spouse to keep the children and this
person smokes drugs in front of them. Birth Parent 1 reported he
has proof in the form of a text and a picture showing the person
“smoking her drugs” after she lays one of the children down for a
nap. He believes Caregiver’s Spouse was teasing him about her
being able to be with the children, while he and Birth Parent 2 are
not. He reported what Caregiver’s Spouse is smoking is either a
marijuana joint or some other drug. He reported disclosing this
information to the agency and providing them the aforementioned
proof. He said the event occurred in May 2024. He reported the
agency said they investigated and addressed the matter with
Caregiver and Caregiver’s Spouse, and they reported there was
nothing of concern.
Birth Parent 1 provided me a copy of the texts and picture he
referenced. A review of the documents showed:
• A text message with a female’s first name at the top of it
and wording in the message that read “Nap time lol. Don’t
you wish you were here. Lol ewww gross”.
• A picture of a women with sunglasses on sitting in a lawn
chair with what appears to be some type of cigarette in her
mouth. Under this picture, in the same screen, is a part of
the text message mentioned above “Nap time lol. Don’t you
wish you were here”. It is not clear from this picture
8

whether the object in her mouth is a cigarette or some other
substance. There are no children in the picture.
I interviewed Foster care Supervisor (FCS) about this allegation by
telephone on 5/31/2024, Foster Care Worker (FCW) by telephone
on 6/5/2024, and Program Manager (PM) by telephone on
6/11/2024.
FCS reported he received a text message about this allegation on
or about 5/28/2024. He reported the birth parent may have
mentioned Caregiver’s Spouse smoking marijuana in the past, not
that Caregiver’s Spouse smokes around the children. He said the
birth parents inquired of him why was he not drug testing the
Caregivers and he explained. FCS said he addressed the matter
with Caregiver’s Spouse during a home visit on 5/14/2024, and the
Caregiver’s Spouse denied smoking Marijuana. FCS reported after
receiving the text picture from the birth parent on 5/28/2024 FCW
followed up on this matter on 5/29/2024. A discussion and safety
plan was conducted with the caregivers.
FCW did not report any specific information outside of what was
reported by the FCS.
PM did not report information related to this allegation.
Allegation 2
I interviewed Birth Parent 1 by telephone on 5/29/2024 and Birth
Parent 2 by telephone on 6/6/2024.
Birth Parent 1 reported the agency is shutting them out of their
children lives. That they do not get information on the children’s
doctor appointments and their daughter, Child A, had dental surgery
without their consent.
He further reported the agency has not provided them with any
report cards for the children or anything related to school. He
admitted the agency provided him some type of picture book related
to his son, Child B, on 5/8/2024.
Birth Parent 2 reported the agency is not doing all they can related
to their visits or trying to reunify her with her children as ordered by
the court. They also do not keep her and Birth Parent 1 aware of
what’s going on with the children. She said the agency allowed her
daughter, Child A, to have dental surgery without her consent. She
reported that Child A grinds her teeth and had some plaque which
caused a problem with her back teeth. She said she had taken
9

Child A to the dentist six months ago, as well as had taken Child A
to see a private dentist prior to the children entering care. She did
not believe the agency when they reported that the Caregiver did
the dental surgical procedure without the agency’s knowledge. She
said the agency knew. The agency filled out paperwork for the
surgery, which was either on 9/18/2023 or 1/16/2024. She said the
dates on the document is confusing and suspicious because the
agency is putting whatever dates they want on forms. She provided
a copy of the document she referenced.
Birth Parent 2 reported the agency has not provided her medical
appointments for the children, that she has only received medical
passports. Conversely, Birth Parent 2 admitted she has scheduled
medical appointments for the children. She reported in March 2024,
the agency told her the birth parents were responsible, so she had
scheduled and taken the children for appointments. She stated the
agency has also scheduled some appointments without her
knowledge, and DHHS (Department of Health and Human Services)
had gotten some immunizations for the children, because the
Caregiver wanted them.
Birth Parent 2 further reported the agency has not allowed her
involvement in Child A’s school events. She reported the prior FCW
advised her that if she wanted to participate in Child A’s events
someone from the agency had to be there. She said there was an
event, a graduation today and she attended, but the worker did not
want her there. She said the school has blocked her from attending
parent/teacher conferences until Caregiver could be present.
Caregiver would give her incorrect information about the
parent/teacher conference.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) about this allegation
by telephone on 5/31/2024, he reported the case plan is
reunification and efforts continue related to that plan. He reported
Child A (age 5), Child B (age 2) and Child C (age 10 months) which
this complaint relates are placed with an unlicensed relative. He
denied the allegation of the agency not sharing information with the
birth parents. He reported Child A is the only child of the three
children that is attending an educational program. Child A is also
the child who had dental care issues. During Child A’s treatment for
cavities on or about 1/18/2024, Child A was given a general
anesthesia with the Caregiver’s consent, and without the agency’s
knowledge. The agency learned of this treatment method after the
fact and informed the birth parents of the matter soon after it
occurred. FCS said the agency also followed up with the dental
office on or about 1/19/2024 and advised the dentist that the birth
10

parents still have rights and must consent to such treatment
procedures.
FCS reported the birth parents are involved in the children’s health
care. He said the children have not had any new medical or dental
appointments. He said the birth parents took Child C to a well child
appointment on 3/27/2024 and took Child A and Child B to dental
appointments on 3/27/2024 and 5/20/2024, during parenting time.
He advised there may have been one time or so that the children
had gone to the doctor for illnesses without Caregiver reporting that
to them. He reported one of the birth parents asking him via text
message in early May 2024, why the kids keep going to the doctor
without their knowledge. FCS reported he made contact with
Caregiver on this matter, during a subsequent office visit. Caregiver
reported the doctor visit or visits were due to the child or children
being sick. He advised Caregiver they must also report these visits
to the agency, so that the agency can keep the birth parents
informed.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. He reported being the case manager on the
case for Child A, Child B, and Child C since April 2024. He reported
the case plan remains reunification, and notwithstanding the recent
DHHS allegation for the birth parents or Birth Parent 2’s positive
drug screen, the agency’s plan is to work toward that goal. The
agency is not seeking a permanent relative placement with
Caregiver, reunification with the birth parents is still being worked
on. Additionally, the agency is not trying to keep medical
information/appointments for the children from the birth parents. He
reported Child A’s dental treatment with the anesthesia occurred
prior to his assignment on the case, but he was told Caregiver gave
permission without the agency’s knowledge or consent. He
reported not being aware of a specific medical or dental
appointment not being shared with the birth parent. He reported
Birth Parent 2 had told him she set up appointments for the
children. Caregiver had also mentioned scheduling dental
appointments for Child B and Child C, but Caregiver could not recall
the date. FCW reported two different dates were given respectively
by Caregiver and birth parent and only one was confirmed.
He reported so as to not have what occurred around Child A’s
dental treatment reoccur, he completed a safety plan with Caregiver
in May 2024. He advised Caregiver they cannot just sign for things
related to the children’s care. He said, Caregiver signed a safety
plan related to this. He provided me a copy of that safety plan on
6/5/2024. It was signed by FCW on 5/30/2024, with a notation that
11

Caregiver, (as referred by his first name) agreed verbally on
5/30/2024. This safety plan indicated Caregiver would/will:
• Let FCW know of upcoming medicals and dentals.
• Give FCW 24-hour notice of upcoming appointment.
• Not consent to any major medical decisions without parental
consent (anything outside of routine care).
• Only give routine medical care.
• Allow the biological parents to attend medical, dental, etc.
appointments.
• Let FCW know about parenting times that the caregiver
administered.
FCW confirmed FCS’s reporting about Child A being the only one of
Birth Parent 1’s and Birth Parent 2’s three children in school. He
reported Child A is in kindergarten and no information is being kept
from the birth parent. He reported Birth Parent 1 and Birth Parent 2
being upset with him about Child A’s kindergarten celebration. He
reported only finding out about the event on 6/4/2024, and he told
the birth parents on 6/5/2025. He reported the day before he was
trying to work out parenting issues. The birth parents felt they
should have known sooner and were upset about not being able to
attend, which they did anyway. He affirmed that Caregiver is Birth
Parent 2’s father and was not sure why Caregiver had not shared
the information with the birth parents.
I interviewed Program Manager (PM) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. PM reported information similarly to what
FCS reported related to Child A and the caregiver’s action around
the child’s dental treatment. She said the prior FCW addressed the
issue with Caregiver and advised Caregiver of the agency’s need to
be advised in advance of the child’s need for any treatment so that
proper consent can be obtained from the parents. She reported
having the discussion with that FCW. She reported most recently
the current FCW also addressed this matter with Caregiver.
She reported there may have been an appointment whereby
Caregiver took Child B and or Child C for a doctor’s visit when the
child was sick and did not share that information with the agency.
The latter is also why the current FCW safety planned with
Caregiver on letting FCW/the agency know about medical and
dental appointments they schedule for the children, as well as when
they take the children to the doctor due to being sick.
PM also reported the birth parents were scheduling some of the
children medical appointments during their unsupervised parenting
time. The birth parents also went to the school related to Child A’s
12

school functions.
Document Review:
• Safety plan as described in the narrative section for this
allegation.
• The text message and photo provided by Birth Parent 1 as
described in the narrative section for this allegation.
• Child A’s, Child B’s and Child C’s MISACWIS case record
which showed:
➢ The children entered care on 9/19/2023 and were
placed with the Caregiver on that date.
➢ The children were placed under this agency’s
supervision on 9/22/2023.
➢ The children were made temporary court wards on
9/19/2023..
➢ Initial placement medicals for each child on 9/18/2023;
and subsequent medicals. Other than the medical
examination on 9/18/2023 that indicated Caregiver
and Caregiver’s Spouse took the children to the
medical appointment, the others did not.
➢ Various medical passports for the children either
signed by both birth parents or by Birth Parent 1 or
Birth Parent 2.
➢ A document received from Birth Parent 2 on 6/6/2024
titled “Operation & Invasive Procedure, History and
Physical” by/from Dental Office C, for Child A denoting
a well child and office visit date of 9/18/2023. This
form showed Child A’s past medical history
information and listed the child’s diagnosis as “Dental
Decay”. The document was signed by a stated doctor
on 11/16/2023. The document showed what appeared
be a fax date of 11/7/2023 at the top. The document
did not indicate a surgical procedure being performed
or needing to be performed. The document did not
appear to have been doctored or that any dates were
changed.
➢ A document received from Birth Parent 2 on 6/6/2024
titled “Patient Progress Notes” dated 1/18/2024.
The document showed Caregiver, indicated on the
form as the legal guardian (referred to as “grandpa”),
was in the office that day with Child A for in office
general anesthesia and treatment due to the child’s
high risk due to a high amount of cavities and decay.
Caregiver agreed to the treatment and extraction and
signed the consent form.
➢ A 1/19/2024 social work contact showing the Prior
13

FCW called the dental office and advised them that
Caregiver cannot consent to anything other than
routine dental care. The Dentist stated they were not
aware of that because, the Caregiver/ “grandpa”
stated he was the children's legal guardian. The Prior
FCW advised the dentist that was incorrect and that
anything outside of routine care requires consent from
the birth parents.
➢ Child A is in kindergarten.
➢ Family Team Meetings (FTM) completed by the
agency showing birth parents in attendance and the
children’s adjustment and needs being discussed;
inclusive of a 4/2/2024 FTM attended by Birth Parent 1
where Child A’s school attendance was discussed,
and her doing well with her homework.
➢ A 1/17/2024-4/15/2024 USP which showed:
✓ A number of requests for information, and or

Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section (1) An agency shall develop a plan of visitation and family time for
Description each child in foster care consistent with the child’s service plans as

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The foster care worker told the children’s caregiver not to bring the
children to the Infant mental health visits.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Birth Parent 1 by telephone on 5/29/2024, and Birth
Parent 2 by telephone on 6/6/2024:
Birth Parent 1 reported he and Birth Parent 2 have had parenting
time visits with their children since 9/1/2023. Additionally, they have
had Infant Mental Health (IMH) visits with the children, supervised
with a therapist twice weekly. He said the agency is now doing
everything the agency can to ruin these visits for them. The agency
allows the children’s Caregiver, to show up late. Birth Parent 1
acknowledged that the agency allows their visit to go longer when
the caregiver shows up late. He reported when they complain to
the agency about Caregiver’s behavior the agency does nothing to
address Caregiver’s actions. He said the agency took their
overnight visits away, because the agency alleged Birth Parent 2
had tested positive for Methamphetamines, but they provided
information from Birth Parent 2’s doctor that she may have a false
positive. He denied missing a visit or therapist appointment and
feels the agency is not counting all of this.
Birth Parent 2 confirmed statements made by Birth Parent 1. She
reported the children’s caregiver is her estranged father. She said
FCW told Caregiver on multiple occasions, and as recent as last
week (the week prior to this interview), that Caregiver did not have
to come for the IMH visits. She said there have been three weeks
in a row that Caregiver has missed the visit or has been late. She
estimated the number of times missed or late to be three to five.
She reported according to the agency these visits are a burden on
Caregiver. She said the agency has also changed her and Birth
15

Parent 1’s regular parenting visits from unsupervised visits to
supervised visits. She reported this change came about due to a
month-old erroneous positive drug screen for her, which she
reported was caused by her narcolepsy medication. Additionally,
due to a complaint against her and Birth Parent 1 for allegedly
leaving the children in the car. She said their parenting time visits
have not been consistent and have gone from five times a week to
two hours visits two times a week.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) about this allegation
by telephone on 5/31/2024. He denied this allegation. He reported
the birth parents have IMF therapy appointments with the children
every Friday from 5:30pm-6:30pm in the birth parents home. He
said the birth parents’ regular scheduled parenting time is every
Tuesday from 5:00pm-700pm; supervised by the agency. He
reported there has only been one situation, where Caregiver missed
a visit. That occurred in May 2024, where there was some confusion
about the IMH visit. Caregiver thought FCW told him the visit was a
regular parenting time and Caregiver did not show up at the birth
parents’ home for the IMH visit. Caregiver has not missed any other
IMH or parenting time visits. If Caregiver shows up late for a
parenting visit the agency makes up the time for the birth parents.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) about this allegation by
telephone on 6/5/2024. FCW confirmed the information as reported
by FCS about both the IMH and parenting time visits. He added
further that he addressed the missed IMH visit with Caregiver. He
advised Caregiver that he does not dictate or run the IMH visits, and
the IMH therapist does not dictate or run the parenting time visits
and that Caregiver has to adhere to both visits.
I interviewed Program Manager (PM) by telephone on 6/5/2024.
PM affirmed both FCS’s and FCW’s reporting related to Child A’s,
Child B’s, and Child C’s case plan being reunification. She reported
the agency had recommended return home for the children in April
2024, but then new issues (as reported by FCS and FCW related to
the birth parent’s drug screen and the DHHS complaint) surfaced.
PM denied the agency making any efforts to push adoption of the
children by Caregiver. She reported FCS and FCW could better
address this allegation.
Document Review:
Child A’s, Child B’s, and Child C’s MISACWIS case record showed:
• The children’s case plan as reunification.
• Service efforts by the agency with/for the birth parents;
inclusive of substance abuse and therapist referrals, drug
16

testing, scheduling of parenting time visits.
• Ongoing parenting times being scheduled/documented.
• No indication of the agency advising Caregiver to not attend
birth parent parenting times or IMH visits.
Analysis Based on information from interviews and documentation reviewed,
the evidence does not substantiate the allegations or show a lack of
effort by the agency to develop a plan of visitation and family time
for the children and ensuring their safety and wellbeing.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED.
